p: The cpDNA genome is characterized by its slow evolution caused by low mutation rate (Palmer & Herbon, 1988). Thus, the observed high haplotype diversity ( F ST > 0.2) that is coupled with very low gene flow indicates that yellowhorn populations have been isolated for a very long time and may undergo further habitat fragmentation. Furthermore, while the mode of inheritance of yellowhorn's chloroplast is unknown, it is expect to be material as most angiosperms (Reboud & Zeyl, 1994), thus limiting gene flow due to the species large seed (Wang, Huang et al., 2017; Wang, Yang et al., 2017), further contributing to fragmentation.
